passages.text: August 29, 2025 02:38 PM GMT
Huaxin Cement Co | Asia Pacific

Huaxin benefited from improvement of domestic cement GP/t and overseas volume growth in 1H25. It also completed a Nigeria cement business acquisition faster than market expectation; we expect positive market reaction.

1H25 net profit grew \(51\%\) YoY, to Rmb1.1bn, in line with its preliminary earnings range of Rmb1.1- 1.13bn. For 2Q25 alone, net profit came in at Rmb870mn, up \(57\%\) YoY. We attribute the strong 1H25 result to improvement of domestic cement GP/t and overseas volume growth.

Overall cement shipment volume declined, but there was fast growth in overseas markets: Huaxin achieved 27.7mnt cement and clinker sales volume in 1H25, down \(2.6\%\) YoY, while overseas shipments grew \(10.4\%\) to \(8.4\mathrm{mnT}\) . We estimate 2Q25 cement and clinker shipments reached \(\sim 15.5\mathrm{mnT}\) , down \(3\%\) YoY but up \(26\%\) QoQ.

Cement and clinker GP/t increased Rmb35/t YoY, to Rmb98/t in 1H25: We estimate that GP/t in 2Q25 was Rmb103/t vs. Rmb92/t in 1Q25, likely due to seasonal pickup of overseas volume. For the domestic market, some price decline due to weak demand may put some pressure on 3Q25 GP/t, while cement pricing in central China has bottomed in mid- Aug.

Steady growth of aggregate business: Huaxin achieved aggregate sales of 76.1mnt during 1H25, realizing \(45\%\) of full- year guidance of 17Omnt, up \(6.3\%\) YoY. On the other hand, we calculate that unit gross profit declined to Rmb17/t, down \(11\%\) YoY, representing gross profit margin of \(4.8\%\) . Segment gross profit declined \(6\%\) YoY as a result. Per our estimates, revenue contribution from the non- cement business (aggregate, concrete, and others) remained at \(45\%\) in 1H25, the same as for 2024. Overall gross profit contribution from these segments declined to \(46\%\) in 1H25, from \(4.8\%\) in 2024.

Huaxin completed an acquisition of an 83.81% stake in Lafarge Africa (Nigeria cement business) on Aug 29, faster than the market expected, with consideration of \(\sim \mathrm{US}\) 74mn, and has said it plans to conduct a tender offer for the remaining share. Large Africa realized \(\sim \mathrm{US}\) 85mn net profit in 1H25. We think the completion of the deal is a major step for Huaxin to expand in west Africa, and should bring a substantial contribution to Huaxin's earnings ahead. We expect the market to react positively to this news.
We will be hosting Huaxin Cement (600801. SS / 6655. HK) 1H25 Post- Results NDR Group Call on Sep 1 (Mon) at 10.45am, sign up here.

Our price target is derived using a discounted cash flow model, which discounts earnings forecasts through 2030e, using a cost of equity of \(13.1\%\) . We apply a risk- free rate of \(2.7\%\) , risk premium of \(7.3\%\) , and a beta of 1.4. Our terminal growth rate is \(1\%\) .
1) Better-than-expected demand in Hubei and Yunnan help absorb the impact from looser supply/demand.
2) Production suspension and environmental cuts are stricter than expected.
1) Weak fundamentals in Guizhou markets influences pricing environment in southwestern and central China.
2) Slower-than-expected growth of oversea business

The Stock Ratings described below apply to Morgan Stanley's Fundamental Equity Research and do not apply to Debt Research produced by the Firm. For disclosure purposes only (in accordance with FINRA requirements), we include the category headings of Buy, Hold, and Sell alongside our ratings of Overweight, Equal- weight, Not- Rated

and Underweight. Morgan Stanley does not assign ratings of Buy, Hold or Sell to the stocks we cover. Overweight, Equal-weight, Not-Rated and Underweight are not the equivalent of buy, hold, and sell but represent recommended relative weightings (see definitions below). To satisfy regulatory requirements, we correspond Overweight, our most positive stock rating, with a buy recommendation; we correspond Equal-weight and Not-Rated to hold and Underweight to sell recommendations, respectively.

Due to rounding off of decimals, the percentages provided in the % of total' column may not add up to exactly 100 percent.

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months. Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months. Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months. Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months. Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.

Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12- 18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below. In- Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12- 18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below. Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12- 18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below. Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI sub- regional index or MSCI AC Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.
